From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


American film

Bill Block
Steve Schneider
Roy Lee
Starring
Willa Fitzgerald
Kyle Gallner
Barbara Hershey
Ed Begley Jr
CinematographyGiovanni RibisiEdited byChristopher Robin BellProductioncompanies
Miramax
Spooky Pictures
Distributed byMagenta Light StudiosRelease dates
September 22, 2023 (2023-09-22) (Fantastic Fest)
August 23, 2024 (2024-08-23) (United States)
Running time96 minutes[1]CountryUnited StatesLanguageEnglish
Strange Darling is a 2023 American horror-thriller film[2] written and directed by JT Mollner and starring Willa Fitzgerald, Kyle Gallner, Barbara Hershey and Ed Begley Jr.
The film is scheduled to be released in the United States on August 23, 2024.


Premise[edit]
A cat-and-mouse thriller described as a “dramatization of the last known months of a serial killer”.[3]

Cast[edit]
Willa Fitzgerald as the Lady
Kyle Gallner as the Demon
Giovanni Ribisi as Art Pallone
Barbara Hershey
Ed Begley Jr
Production[edit]
Miramax announced that filming on the project was underway in Portland, Oregon in 2022 with JT Mollner working from his own script to direct a cast led by Willa Fitzgerald, Kyle Gallner, Barbara Hershey and Ed Begley Jr. Bill Block, Steve Schneider and Roy Lee acted as producers on the project.[4] The film was shot entirely on 35mm film by director of photography and film cameo, Giovanni Ribisi.[5]

Release[edit]
The film had its premiere on 22 September 2023, at Fantastic Fest held in Austin, Texas.[6]
The film is scheduled to be released in the United States on August 23, 2024.[7]

Reception[edit]
On the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, Strange Darling holds an approval rating of 100% based on 9 reviews.[8]

^ Donnelly, Matt (March 26, 2024). "Fantastic Fest Horror Hit 'Strange Darling' Lands Wide Theatrical Release From New Bob Yari Venture (EXCLUSIVE)". Variety. Retrieved March 27, 2024.
